page.title: 04CLUBS:ASHLEWORTH
page.content: Ashleworth village hall serves as the venue for several {clubs}which one can find going on in the village of Ashleworth.Ashleworth and Hasfield {Women's Institute,}with a paid-up membership of 40 in January,1985,meets on the first Tuesday evening of every month and has a small but keen{Drama {Group}which entertains local village audiences from time to time.The National Housewives' Register operates with a small membership.The hall has a very high ceiling and so it is ideal for{Badminton,}which is played by club members on at least three nights a week.Approximately 8 to 10 ladies (non-club) play every Tuesday afternoon.The Woodpecker's Club,with it's own clubhouse beside it's playing field,runs successful football,cricket and skittle teams.
